algorithm_technique: Prefix XOR sums (mask) and a hashmap to store first occurrences of masks, enabling O(1) lookup for previous states.
problem_summary_simple: Find the longest substring where each vowel appears an even number of times.
problem_summary_technical: Uses a bitmask to represent vowel parity and a hashmap to track the first occurrence of each mask state, allowing efficient calculation of longest valid substrings.
key_insights: The problem can be rephrased as finding the longest subarray where the XOR sum of vowel parities is zero.
A bitmask efficiently encodes the parity of each vowel (a, e, i, o, u).
Storing the first seen index of each mask in a hashmap allows calculating the length of valid substrings in O(1) time.
